author.literal: Q. What is the Circumference of the Earth's Orbit ? A.

container-title: Q. How long does it take the Earth to perform a Journey Round the Sun ? A
note: Three hundred and sixty-five and a quarter days.
title: About 600 millions of miles

container-title: Q. What places on the Earth have 90 Degrees of Latitude ? A. The north and south poles
title: On a meridian, and is reckoned 90 degrees
In how Long a Time does the Moon Make a Revolution Around the Earth from one Fixed Star to the same Star again ? 56 ELEMENTARY ASTRONOMY*

note: A. Not less than 70,300 miles an hour. ELEMENTARY ASTRONOMY. L
title: But, as She keeps up with the Earth Around the Sun, at the Same Time, What is Her Rate of Motion ?

author.literal: Q. Has the Moon a Rotation on its Axis ? A. She has.

title: She 'revolves on her axis in about 2 Todays, or just the time in which she revolves around the earth
How Far are Eclipses of the Moon Visible ?
Will you more Fully Illustrate and Explain the Principles of Gravitation ?

container-title: Q. How was the Distance of the Earth from the Sun Found? ELEMENTARY ASTRONOMY
title: Did Astronomers Find it as Easy to Determine the Distance of a Planet from the Sun, as they did its Periodic Time ? A. They did not.They found the task very difficult
I have examined the Chart of Mr. Emmons, and would commend it to Teachers, as a valuable aid in teaching Astronomy
